children.name: lyrics
children.definition: the words of a song : lời bài hát
examples: Paul Simon writes the lyricsformost of his songs.

children.name: sing the lyrics
examples: He's very good at singing his own lyrics though, on the albums and mp3s that I've got.

children.name: Ladysmith Black Mambazo sings the traditional music of Africa
refrain
children.definition: part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each verse: điệp khúc

children.name: words U
children.definition: wordsthe words that are sung as part of a song : lời ca
examples: I know the tune, but I've forgotten the words.

children.name: the words to
examples: Many people don't know the words to the country's national anthem.

children.name: verse
children.definition: one of the parts into which a song is divided : đoạn nhạc
examples: Each verse was sung as a solo and then everyone joined in on the chorus.
She sang the first verse of ‘Amazing Grace’.

children.name: chorus
children.definition: part of a song which is repeated several times after each verse : điệp khúc

children.name: join in a chorus
examples: I'll sing the verses and I'd like you all tojoin inthe chorus.
Most of the kids were able to join in the chorus.

children.name: tune
children.definition: the main series of notes in a piece of music, without the words(use this especially when you think it is nice to listen to) giai điệu
examples: I recognize the tune, but I can’t remember what it’s called.

children.name: play a tune
examples: He played a tune on the piano.

children.name: hum/whistle a tune
examples: She was humming a little tune to herself.

children.name: write/compose a tune
examples: They wrote many great tunes together in the 80s.

children.name: catchy/memorable
children.definition: one that is easy to remember
examples: His songs have simple words and catchy tunes.

children.name: the theme tune/signature tune
children.definition: the tune at the beginning or end of a television programme etc
examples: the theme tune from the movie 'Titanic'

children.name: a show tune
children.definition: a tune from a musical
examples: Broadway show tunes

children.name: a dance tune
examples: The DJ played some bouncy dance tunes.

children.name: The music box plays the tune ‘Send in the Clowns.’
examples: I’ve heard that tune before, but I don’t know the words to the song.
That’s a nice tune.

children.name: to the tune of sth(= using the same tune as another song)
examples: The song was sung to the tune of "Amazing Grace".

children.name: a hymn tunea rousing hymn tune
melody
children.definition: the main series of notes in a piece of music that has many lines being played at the same time: giai điệu chính
examples: The song has a simple melody and beautiful lyrics.
Melody is not the central element in Martino’s compositions - rhythm is more important.
He played a few well-known melodies.
His songs are always strong on melody.
The song has a simple melody and beautiful lyrics.

children.name: a sweet/pretty/lovely melody
children.definition: pleasant
examples: The pianist played a sweet melody.

children.name: a good/strong melody
examples: It’s hard to find rules about what makes a good melody.

children.name: a simple melody
examples: I like songs with a simple melody.

children.name: a catchy melody
children.definition: one that is easy to remember
examples: With their catchy melodies, the songs are likely to be hits.

children.name: a haunting melody
children.definition: used about a beautiful melody, especially one that is rather sad and which you remember for a long time
examples: He began to play a soulful, haunting melody.

children.name: a plaintive melody
children.definition: sad
examples: The song's plaintive melody expresses perfectly the feeling of loneliness that she feels after her lover has gone.

children.name: a lilting melody
children.definition: rising and falling in a pleasant way
examples: Lennon’s voice enters with a gently lilting melody.

children.name: a pop melody
children.definition: one that is typical of a pop song
examples: The album’s perfect pop melodies make it probably the best record this year.

children.name: have a melody
examples: All his songs have good melodies.

children.name: play a melody
examples: At this point, the flute begins to play the melody.

children.name: sing a melody
examples: She sang the melodies as though she loved them.

children.name: carry the melody
children.definition: play or sing the melody, while other voices or instruments play other notes
examples: The soprano voice carries the melody.

children.name: the melody line
children.definition: the melody, compared to the other parts of the music
examples: The melody line is often set too high for people singing in church.

children.name: piece
children.definition: / piece of music an arrangement of musical notes that has been written by sb (use this about music without words) bản nhạc
examples: The CD contains two pieces performed by the Tokyo String Quartet.
It’s difficult to know ahead of time whether an audience will like a new piece of music.

children.name: song
children.definition: a) a short piece of music with words that you sing : bài hát
examples: We used to listen to pop songs on the radio.
They sat round with guitars, singing songs.

children.name: sing a song
examples: He started singing a little song.

children.name: play a song
children.definition: with singing and musical instruments
examples: The band played a lot of their old songs.

children.name: perform a song
children.definition: in public
examples: He doesn’t like performing his songs live.

children.name: write/compose a song
examples: Do they write their own songs?

children.name: record a song
children.definition: onto a CD so that it can be sold
examples: The song was first recorded in 1982.

children.name: good/great
examples: That’s a great song!

children.name: new
examples: Are any of the songs on the album new?

children.name: old
examples: People always want to hear their old songs.

children.name: a pop/folk song
examples: I love all those '60s pop songs.

children.name: a popular s ong
children.definition: used mainly of songs written before the 1960s
examples: a popular song from the 1930s

children.name: a love song
examples: He is releasing an album of love songs for Valentine’s Day.

children.name: a protest song
examples: They were singing old protest songs from the 1960s.

children.name: a
examples: Beatles/REM etc songCan you play any Beatles songs?

children.name: burst/break into song
children.definition: start singing
examples: The crowd spontaneously burst into song.

children.name: composition
children.definition: a piece of music that sb has written - use this when you are considering the way the music is written:tác phẩm
examples: Stone’s composition ‘Idaho’ became a national hit when Benny Goodman recorded it for Columbia.
Zwilich’s flute concerto was nominated for Best Contemporary Classical Composition.
This concerto is one of her earlier/later compositions.
a composition by jazzman Dave Brubeck, called ‘Chromatic Fantasy’
a mixture of traditional songs and original compositions

children.name: work
children.definition: a piece of music, especially a longclassicalone - use this inwrittenorformalcontexts: tác phẩm
examples: The performance began with two of Mozart’s early works.
Handel’s ‘Messiah’ is one of the most majestic musical works ever written.

children.name: a piece of music for dancing
bolero
children.definition: a type of Spanish dance, or the music for this dance
examples: Ravel's Bolero

children.name: cha-cha
children.definition: / cha-cha-cha a piece of music written for an energetic modern dance, originally from South America, involving small fast steps and movement of the bottom from side to side

children.name: dance
children.definition: a piece of music which you can dance to :
examples: The band was playing a slow dance.

children.name: rumba
children.definition: / rhumba a type of dancing, originally from Cuba, or the music for this

children.name: samba
children.definition: the type of music played for this dance

children.name: tango
children.definition: a fast dance from South America, or a piece of music for this dance

children.name: waltz
children.definition: a piece of music intended for this type of dance :
examples: a Strauss waltz

children.name: sonata
children.definition: a piece of music with three or four parts that is written for a piano, or for a piano and another instrument : bản xô nát
examples: a piano sonata

children.name: symphony
children.definition: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra : bản giao hưởng
examples: Mahler's 9th symphony
Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony

children.name: serenade
children.definition: a piece of gentle classical music in several parts : dạ khúc
examples: 'Moonlight Serenade'

children.name: parts of a large piece of music
passage
children.definition: a short piece of writing or music which is part of a larger piece of work : phân đoạn

children.name: an orchestral passage
examples: Students can slow down the tempo or loop a particular section of music to practice difficult passages.

children.name: part
children.definition: the music that one type of instrument or voice within a group plays or sings : phần chơi, hát của một người
examples: The violin part is difficult.
The choir sings in four-part harmony.

children.name: coda
children.definition: specialized a piece of music at the end of a longer piece of music, which is usually separate from the basic structure : đoạn cuối
examples: The coda is often more technically difficult than the rest of the piece.

children.name: a piece of music for one or more musicans
solo
children.definition: a piece of music for one performer : bản solo

children.name: a gorgeous piano solo
examples: She has to play a trumpet solo in this piece.
Parker's solo on 'A Night in Tunisia' was so amazing that the pianist backing him simply stopped playing.

children.name: trio
children.definition: a piece of music that has been written to be performed by three people:
examples: The final item in today's programme is Beethoven's Trio in B flat.

children.name: duet
children.definition: a song or other piece of music sung or played by two people

children.name: number
children.definition: a piece of popular music that forms part of a longer performance : tiết mục, bài hát

children.name: ‘The show’s not very good.’ ‘We can leave after this number if you want.’
examples: Nell Carter also appeared and performed a couple of upbeat numbers.
Madonna sang several numbers from her latest album.
The show was brilliant, from the opening number to the end.

children.name: track
children.definition: one of several songs or pieces of music on a CD or other musical recording :
examples: The album includes four previously unreleased tracks.
Track three is my favourite one.

children.name: introduction
children.definition: / introinformal a short part at the beginning of a song or piece of music
examples: The song's great, but the introduction's a bit too long.

children.name: songbook
children.definition: a book with the words and music of many songs

children.name: fanfare
children.definition: a short loud piece of music played on a trumpet to introduce an important person or event: khúc nhạc nghi lễ
examples: a trumpetfanfare
